meanings.definition: Not able to be relied on; not known or definite.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast was uncertain, so we brought both an umbrella and sunglasses.
meanings.sent2: She felt uncertain about which path to take in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The uncertain cat couldn't decide if it wanted to go outside or stay in.
meanings.sent4: His uncertain smile revealed his inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The uncertain future loomed ahead, full of possibilities.

meanings.definition: Not completely confident or sure of something.
meanings.sent1: He was uncertain about his answer during the test.
meanings.sent2: She was uncertain if she locked the door before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The uncertain student nervously tapped their pencil on the desk.
meanings.sent4: Her uncertain voice wavered as she spoke in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The uncertain expression on his face gave away his lack of conviction.
